kubejs.ponder.pressure_chamber.text_1: Pressure chambers are formed by making a cube that is at least 3x3x3, with at least one pressure chamber valve
kubejs.ponder.pressure_chamber.text_10: Regular chests can't fit larger items, so it is best to use higher tier storage blocks like crates or reinforced chests
kubejs.ponder.pressure_chamber.text_2: Chamber glass can optionally be used instead of chamber walls
kubejs.ponder.pressure_chamber.text_3: Finally, at least two interfaces are required to transfer items in and out
kubejs.ponder.pressure_chamber.text_4: Orientation of the interface determines whether it's an import (blue) or an export (orange)
kubejs.ponder.pressure_chamber.text_5: Placing an interface from the outside will make an import
kubejs.ponder.pressure_chamber.text_6: Placing an interface from the inside will make an export
kubejs.ponder.pressure_chamber.text_7: Items can be pushed into an import with a hopper, a funnel or a chute
kubejs.ponder.pressure_chamber.text_8: Outputs can be taken to a storage directly
kubejs.ponder.pressure_chamber.text_9: Both actions require the chamber to be at a high pressure
